txt.en: Bring the small skeleton to Mincham, at his camp.

'Have you come to mock me? Hobbits are the finest archers in all the lands, and there is no one who can tell me different!

'Oh, sorry. I do get a little annoyed with strangers questioning my beliefs. Let me tell you that there were definitely hobbits at the Battle of Fornost. I just need to find proof. Can you help me?

'I need to collect arrowheads from the hobbits that were slain at Fornost. If you could bring me several, that should show those doubters!'
'Wonderful! I knew I was right! You found them! Thank you, thank you, thank you!\n\n'Please take this as a small token of my appreciation!'
'Did you find the arrowheads? There must be small skeletons around everywhere that have the arrowheads on them. Please find them quickly.'
Collected arrowheads ([placeholder]/20)

The Tooks in the camp at Fornost are desperately looking for proof that hobbits fought in the Battle of Fornost. They have been ridiculed for their beliefs, so they have come to find the proof they so desperately need.

This small skeleton was unearthed from its burial mound and tossed heedlessly aside.  The skull is cleaved by an axe, suggesting that this person died in battle, long ago.  Most incredible of all, the skeleton is too small to belong to a Man or an Elf.  \n\nPerhaps the Rangers who watch the Fields of Fornost would know more...
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Shield to Brombard Foxe.
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Helm to Brombard Foxe.
Collect arrowheads ([placeholder]/20)
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Helm to Brombard Foxe.
Bring the arrowheads to Bartelot Took
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Short Sword to Brombard Foxe, in the Mathom House.
Find an ancient hobbit sword
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Shield to Brombard Foxe, in the Mathom House.
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Helm to Brombard Foxe.
Find an ancient hobbit shield
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Helm to Brombard Foxe, in the Mathom House.
Find an ancient hobbit helm

'An ancient sword, shield and helm, you say?  Yes, the Mathom House may be interested in purchasing such things.  But I shall have to see all three items first, and you do not seem to have them with you!'
Bring the ancient hobbit sword, shield, and helm to Brombard Foxe.
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Short Sword to Brombard Foxe.

'An ancient sword, shield and helm, you say?  Yes, the Mathom House may be interested in purchasing such things.  But I shall have to see all three items first, and you do not seem to have them with you!'

'An ancient sword, shield and helm, you say?  Yes, the Mathom House may be interested in purchasing such things.  But I shall have to see all three items first, and you do not seem to have them with you!'
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Shield to Brombard Foxe, in the Mathom House.
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Shield to Brombard Foxe.
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Helm to Brombard Foxe, in the Mathom House.
Bring the Ancient Hobbit Shield to Brombard Foxe.

'What's this, then?' The old Hobbit peers at the ancient arms.  'Why!  What a perfectly remarkable find!  And they're from the field of Fornost, you say? So the stories are true! 'The Forgotten Company,' and all that. Always believed the tales, myself.  Legend grows from a seed of truth, as they say.\n\n'Of course the Mathom House will pay handsomely for these artifacts, if you are willing to part with them.  To think that Hobbits fought at Fornost!  Perfectly remarkable!'

To think that Hobbits fought at Fornost!  Perfectly remarkable!'

'The Forgotten Company,' and all that. Always believed the tales, myself. To think that Hobbits fought at Fornost!  Perfectly remarkable!'
You might find hobbit arrowheads among the skeletons within Fornost, north of the Fornost camp.
Bartelot Took is at the Fornost Camp, south of Fornost itself.\n\nYour search produced a large number of arrowheads. You should take them to Bartelot Took.

Mincham also asked you to collect an ancient hobbit sword, shield, and helm from the hobbit burial mounds. In addition to the mound where you found the skeleton, you noticed three other hobbit mounds on the Fields of Fornost.
Mincham has asked you to bring the ancient hobbit sword, shield, and helm to Brombard Foxe, the Mathom House Keeper, in the Shire. The Mathom House can be found in the town of Michel Delving.
Rebury the Hobbit skeleton near the Hobbit burial site.

Mincham looks closely at the small skeleton.  'So, the stories are true!' he exclaims at last.  'These are the remains of a Hobbit. Long have the Small Folk avowed that they sent a company of archers to aid us at Fornost. Never before has there been any proof!

'Yet we should return him to his tomb, with his fellows. Bury him in whatever small mound of earth you can find, near the place where you discovered him.

'When you have finished, gather a Hobbit sword, shield, and helm from the Hobbits' mounds, and bring them to the Mathom House, in the Shire. The Small Folk deserve to know the truth behind their legends, and their fallen warriors deserve to be honoured by their kin!'

'What's this, then?' The old Hobbit peers at the ancient arms.  'Why!  What a perfectly remarkable find!  And they're from the field of Fornost, you say? So the stories are true! 'The Forgotten Company,' and all that. Always believed the tales, myself.  Legend grows from a seed of truth, as they say.\n\n'Of course the Mathom House will pay handsomely for these artifacts, if you are willing to part with them.  To think that Hobbits fought at Fornost!  Perfectly remarkable!'

To think that Hobbits fought at Fornost!  Perfectly remarkable!'
'This is a wonder, to be sure! There is a truly great Hobbit-friend. All hail, [placeholder]!'

'Yet we should return him to his tomb, with his fellows. Bury him in whatever small mound of earth you can find, near the place where you discovered him.

'When you have finished, gather a Hobbit sword, shield, and helm from the burial ground, and bring them to the Mathom House, in the Shire. The Small Folk deserve to know the truth behind their legends, and their fallen warriors deserve to be honoured by their kin!'
'Look, look! The hero of all hobbits everywhere. That [placeholder] proved that hobbits are fierce warriors. I knew it!'

'What's this, then?' The old Hobbit peers at the ancient arms.  'Why!  What a perfectly remarkable find!  And they're from the field of Fornost, you say? So the stories are true! 'The Forgotten Company,' and all that. Always believed the tales, myself.  Legend grows from a seed of truth, as they say.\n\n'Of course the Mathom House will pay handsomely for these artifacts, if you are willing to part with them.  To think that Hobbits fought at Fornost!  Perfectly remarkable!'
'Return to the place you found the skeleton, and you shall likely find smaller mounds of earth.  Bury the poor fellow there, close to his kinsmen.'
Find an Ancient Hobbit Helm.
'The wights have dug at the Hobbits' burial  mounds and strewn their treasures about.  Search for a Hobbit sword, shield, and helm, and bring them to the Mathom House, in Michel Delving.'

Mincham looks at the Hobbit arms and smiles sadly. 'I cannot help but think of the small fellow who carried these arms, all those years ago.  No doubt he believed they would return soon to the Shire.  Well.'  Mincham nods.  'Their return has been delayed, but they may still find their place of honour.  Bring them to the Mathom House, in Michel Delving.  The Mathom House Keeper will receive them gladly, I think...'
Fornost: The Forgotten Company
